an10.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
an10.1:4.3: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,
an10.1:4.4: bowed, sat down to one side,
an10.1:5.1: “Sir, what is the purpose and benefit of wholesome ethics?”
an10.1:5.2: “Ānanda, having no regrets is the purpose and benefit of wholesome ethics.”
an10.1:6.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of having no regrets?”
an10.1:6.2: “Gladness is the purpose and benefit of having no regrets.”
an10.1:7.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of gladness?”
an10.1:8.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of rapture?”
an10.1:9.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of tranquillity?”
an10.1:10.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of bliss?”
an10.1:11.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of samādhi?”
an10.1:12.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing?”
an10.1:13.1: “But what’s the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion?”
an10.1:13.2: “Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.1:14.1: So, Ānanda, the purpose and benefit of wholesome ethics is not having regrets.
an10.1:14.2: Gladness is the purpose and benefit of not having regrets.
an10.1:14.3: Rapture is the purpose and benefit of gladness.
an10.1:14.4: Tranquillity is the purpose and benefit of rapture.
an10.1:14.5: Bliss is the purpose and benefit of tranquillity.
an10.1:14.6: Samādhi is the purpose and benefit of bliss.
an10.1:14.7: Truly knowing and seeing is the purpose and benefit of samādhi.
an10.1:14.8: Disillusionment and dispassion is the purpose and benefit of truly knowing and seeing.
an10.1:14.9: Knowledge and vision of freedom is the purpose and benefit of disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.1:14.10: So, Ānanda, wholesome ethics progressively lead up to the highest.”
